--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, joeraii <joeraii@c...> wrote:

> Yeah, sure, and this is the way its normally done I think. I want to
split
>  them up in order to take advantage of coevolution. Also this way
different
>  developmental systems can be applied to a bunch of different
chromosomes.
> > 

So is your idea mainly to coevolve DNA "starter strings" in one
population and "rule sets" (or something analogous) in another?
If that's it, I take it the main innovation here is not always
starting from a single canonical symbol?  It does sound interesting.

> > 
> > You're a senior at UT now?  Where are you thinking of
> > applying to grad school?
> >
> 
> Yup. The pickings are kinda slim for this evolutionary and developmental
>  systems stuff. I'm gonna apply to some UK schools: University College
>  London, Sussex, and Birmingham. In the US: Brandeis and MIT. And
maybe some
>  others, havent really decided yet. 

UCSD could be another possibility.

ken
